Cashier Job at the Place - Smackers Limited




        
    

        
        The Place - We are a fast growing, world class, and dynamic, multi-billion Nigerian conglomerates, established and managed by a team of professionals with decades of management consulting and accounting experience/ training from Arthur Andersen (now KPMG in Nigeria). We are a profitable player in the QSR sector of the Hospitality industry in Nigeria with great prospects and staff strength of over 1000 employees. Currently, our operations span across 17 locations in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria, with rapid expansion plans to penetrate more locations in the short to medium term.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos



Job Description


	We are currently looking for versatile, intelligent and energetic restaurant cashiers with passion for delivering outstanding service to join our professional and friendly team. This person will be responsible for providing passionate, charming and attentive service delivery to all customers according to our service standards in order to ensure guest satisfaction.
	As the Restaurant Cashier, you will work alongside team members in ensuring customers have a wonderful experience, deliver quality service and maintaining relationships with customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensures customers are attended to in a courteous and friendly manner and swift resolution is given to their issues/complaints
	Ensures sales entries are correctly entered and receipts are issued to customer
	Maintain excellent level of hygiene at all the time
	Must be knowledgeable about the company products
	Must possess suggestive selling skills


Qualifications


	Minimum of SSCE
	Maximum of OND
	Experience in the hospitality industry could be an added advantage but not compulsory
	Must be between 18-25 years old
	Must be able to work in a team enviroment
	Must reside in or be able to work on Lagos mainland.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistic Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Sango Ota, Ogun

Purpose of Job


	Implement and support logistics strategies and activities to achieve efficient and cost-effective handling and dispatch of finished goods to distributors and other locations within the country in order to achieve customer order fulfilment and service delivery in allignment with company policies and statutory regulations.

	Ensure proper filling of all logistics documents to avoid loss of data and breach of statutory regulations.

Logistic Officer Job at Grand Oak Limited




        
    

        
        Grand Oak Limited (GOL) - We believe our spirits should have character; an authenticity derived from where they are distilled, bottled and the philosophies of those who distil them. There are many attributes that describe us resolute, self-sufficient, tough, hard-working, enduring, emotional, passionate, philosophical and engaging. We are the largest Manufacturer of Spirits and Wines.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistic Officer

Job Location: Sango Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Purpose of Job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Implement and support logistics strategies and activities to achieve efficient and cost-effective handling and dispatch of finished goods to distributors and other locations within the country in order to achieve customer order fulfilment and service delivery in allignment with company policies and statutory regulations.


Principal Accountabilities


	Support implementation of the logistics strategies for ease of operations in alignment with GOL business objectives.
	Support the logistics process for the transportation of inbound and outbound goods and services to customers and company warehouses through communication with all stakeholders for efficient and timely delivery of goods.
	Implement pre-dispatch inspection for efficient, safe loading and delivery of goods
	Support evaluation supplier proposals and contracts to ensure compliance with company standards to mitigate supply risks.
	Screen and review driver documents to avoid litigation or avoidable human and material losses
	Ensure proper filling of all logistics documents to avoid loss of data and breach of statutory regulations.


Challenges:


	Truck accidents leading to down time and loss of goods
	Bad road infrastructure
	Unruly behaviour of drivers
	Poor truck management by drivers and third-party logistic companies


Planning & Organizing:


	Macro:Weekly Plans
	Micro: Daily planning


Context of Job
Framework & Boundaries:


	This role is administrative in nature and provides support to the Logistics and Warehouse Manager.
	The Logistic Officer has autonomy to confirm logistic documents, perform truck inspection, liaise with truck drivers and third-party logistic companies for compliance with statutory regulations and enforce adherence to company policies under the supervision of the Logistics & Warehouse Manager to optimize logistics processes while ensuring alignment with business objectives and risk management.


Key Performance Indicators


	Order accuracy
	Daily order fulfilment
	Achieve timely delivery of finished good across the country within S.L.A stipulated time frame
	Finished goods rejection rate targets
	Finished goods stock variance
	Pre-dispatch vehicle inspection targets.


Job Requirements
Education:


	Minimum requirement: First Degree / HND certificate from a recognized higher institution with a grade not less than a Second Class lower or a Lower Credit.
	Added advantage: A master’s degree or an MBA in a related field.


Experience:


	Minimum of 2 years of cognate experience.


Salary
N150,000 monthly.

  "description": "Erisco Foods Limited is an indigenous food product manufacturer, incorporated in Nigeria in 2004 and started operations in 2009, manufacturing Tomato Paste, Seasoning, Rice, Milk cubes and more. We are firmly committed to producing high-quality products that combine nourishment with value pricing, as they strive to become one of Nigeria&rsquo;s largest indigenous foodmanufacturers on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Asaba, Delta

Ethics and Compliance Officer Job at International Breweries Plc




        
    

        
        International Breweries Plc - Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. Beer, the original social network, has been bringing people together for thousands of years. We are committed to building great brands that stand the test of time and to brewing the best beers using the finest natural ingredients.

Our diverse portfolio of well over 400 beer brands includes global brands Budweiser, Corona and Stella Artois; multi-country brands Beck’s, Castle, Castle Lite, Hoegaarden, and Leffe; and local champions such as Aguila, Bud Light, Jupiler, Klinskoye, Modelo Especial, Quilmes, Skol, and Victoria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Ethics and Compliance Officer
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Requisition ID: 30090445
Job Location: Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

Key Purpose


	The key purpose of this role is to support the development and promotion of the Ethics and Compliance (E&C) programs in the Zone.
	The candidate will provide assurance around compliance with legal and regulatory requirements across Company operations and functions.


Key Roles and Responsibilities


	With support of the E&C Manager, ensure that ethics and compliance risks are identified, assessed, and mitigated as part of the risk management processes.
	Support implementation of the annual E&C compliance program, including addressing training needs in key risk areas.
	Ensure that all regulatory permits and licenses remain current and appropriate for the company’s needs.
	Oversight and quarterly report on all E&C dashboards and platforms.
	Perform quarterly audits on compliance dashboard and roadmap as per standards of the global compliance team.
	Drive rigorous process for third party due diligence and monitoring particularly, high risk third parties. Maintain record of high-risk partners with status of mitigation actions.
	Drive quarterly ethics and compliance scorecards and ensure that annual ethics and compliance certification process is completed on a timely basis.
	Provide guidance on the proper and timely use of E&C tools (i.e., Gifts and Donations, TPV management, DOI declaration, Breach database, etc.).
	Conduct ad-hoc investigations and make recommendations to detect, prevent and remediate breaches effectively.
	Management of team budget and timely processing of payments.


Minimum Requirements


	A Degree in Economics, Law, Human Resources or Finance.
	Experience in risk management will be an advantage.
	Experience in policy governance  and compliance as well as strong knowledge of internal controls.


Key Attributes and Competencies:


	Interpersonal relationship building skills
	Problem solving and proven ability to manage projects and facilitate change
	Strong communication skills
	Honest and ethical role model
	Analytical thinker with strong technical and organizational skills with an emphasis on time management and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
	Self-starter, with the ability to stay focused to manage projects and meet deadlines.
